result.execSummary:
The defendant Clairessa Selina Rae Nelis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment.

Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow thru with any recommendations.
  Defendant is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  Defendant is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Defendant finding the funding for such counseling.
  The Defendant is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Defendant.
  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances(MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Defendant is to take all his/her prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physician and all prescribed medication(s) taken only as prescribed!
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
Def to have NO contact w/Wendi Nelson.
  The Defendant is to provide a DNA specimen.
  The Defendant, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under Wisconsin statutes Sect. 941.29 under the Wisconsin Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under Wisconsin State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Restitution is set at -0-.  If, during the period of supervision, a claim for restitution is made the Defendant will be notified!

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
